title: Which Neil Young song has the best lyrics? Why or what does it mean? - Quora

response.answer_text: ‘Powderfinger’ paints a scenario that could be a possibility in a once free society: “the powers that be” coming after folks that they didn’t want to exist Don’t know why the family on the river drew the wrath of a possible fascist state. It’s fiction, so while the story may never occur; the fact that someone would be confronted with a state’s war against their own people is reality. Anyway, the song is very melodic, and fits hand-in-glove with the lyrics. If you haven’t listened to it, then please do. Those who have, will probably have the same take on it as I have. Along, with ‘Thrasher’ and other songs on ‘Rust Never Sleeps’, there’s plenty of powerful lyrics that are well-matched with the music.
